Non»oontrulling interests represent the equity in subsidiaries not attributable, directly or indirectly, to owners of the Company, and are presented separately in the consolidated statement of comprehensive income and within equity in the consolidated balance sheet, separately from equity attributable to owners of the Company,

Changes in the Company owner's ownership interest in a subsidiary that do not result in a loss at control are accounted for as equity transactions. In such circumstances. the carrying amounts of the controlling and non-controlling interesﬁ are adjusted in reﬂect the changes in their relative interests in the subsidiary. Any difference between the amount by which the non-oontrolling interests is adjusted and the fair value of the consideration paid or received is recognised directly in equity and attributed to owners of the Company.

Foreign currency

The financial statements are presented in Singapore Dollars. which is also the Company's tunciional currency. Each entity in the Group determines its own functional currency and items included in the financial statements of each entity are measured using that functional currency.

(a) Transactions and balances

Transactions in foreign currencies are measured in the respective tuncticmal currencies of the Company and its subsidiaries and are recorded on in al recognition in the functional currencies at exchange rates approximating those ruling at the transaction dates. Monetary assets and liabilities denominated in foreign currencies are translated at the rate oi exchange ruling at the end oi the reporting period. Non-monetary items that are measured in terms of historical cost in a foreign currency are translated using the exchange mtes as at the dates of the initial transactions. Non-monetary items measured atiair value in a foreign currency are tmnslated using the exchange mtes at the date when the fair value was measured.

Exchange differences arising on the settlement of monetary items or on translating monetary items at the end of the reporting period are recognised in protit or loss except for exchange differences arising on monetary items that form part otthe Group’s net investment in foreign operations, which are recognised initially in other comprehensive income and accumulated under foreign currency translation reserve in equity. The foreign currency translation reserve is reclassified from equity to profit or loss of the Group on disposal ot the foreign operation.
